bill_title: Commending and honoring Clarice Thyen, Waverly, South Dakota, as the 1999-2000 Outstanding School Board Member.

bill_versions.bill_text: A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Commending and honoring Clarice Thyen, Waverly, South Dakota, as the 1999-2000 Outstanding School Board Member. WHEREAS, Clarice Thyen has served the Waverly Schools for twenty-three years and has served as vice-president and president during her tenure on the school board as well as being an outstanding mother and role model for her twelve children; and WHEREAS, Clarice Thyen has served the educational community in South Dakota by holding statewide leadership positions including the Board of Directors of Associated School Boards of South Dakota and serving as the voting delegate for her district for eleven years; and WHEREAS, Clarice Thyen has been an active participant and leader in her church, local community, and regional education organizations and a contributor to the school programs in the implementation of computer technology and the construction of a new school-community football/softball complex: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Seventy-fifth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that Mrs. Clarice Thyen be honored for being selected as the 1999-2000 Outstanding School Board Member and that she be designated an official representative of the state for the year 2000 to continue her efforts to seek improvement of educational opportunities for all citizens of the state.

A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Commending and honoring Clarice Thyen, Waverly, South Dakota, as the 1999-2000 Outstanding School Board Member. WHEREAS, Clarice Thyen has served the Waverly Schools for twenty-three years and has served as vice-president and president during her tenure on the school board as well as being an outstanding mother and role model for her twelve children; and WHEREAS, Clarice Thyen has served the educational community in South Dakota by holding statewide leadership positions including the Board of Directors of Associated School Boards of South Dakota and serving as the voting delegate for her district for eleven years; and WHEREAS, Clarice Thyen has been an active participant and leader in her church, local community, and regional education organizations and a contributor to the school programs in the implementation of computer technology and the construction of a new school-community football/softball complex: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Seventy-fifth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that Mrs. Clarice Thyen be honored for being selected as the 1999-2000 Outstanding School Board Member and that she be designated an official representative of the state for the year 2000 to continue her efforts to seek improvement of educational opportunities for all citizens of the state.
